caption:
This photograph captures an aerial view of a long bridge extending across a wide body of water. The bridge appears to be a straightforward, multi-span structure with regular supporting piers visible beneath it, creating a series of ripples and disturbances in the water as it flows past. The bridge connects two land masses, with one end anchored on a small, more developed piece of land that hosts several small buildings and possibly a parking lot, suggesting this might be a rest area or a toll station.

The water surrounding the bridge is calm, with mild ripples, indicating a serene setting, possibly early morning or late evening, as inferred from the soft, diffused light. The background features a line of trees and what seems to be a distant shoreline, adding a sense of spaciousness and tranquility to the scene.

Overall, the image impresses with its quiet and orderly composition, focusing on infrastructure within a natural landscape. The photograph likely aims to showcase either the engineering feat of the bridge or the serene environment in which it is set.
title: In the spring of 1973 the Mississippi River reached its highest level in more than 150 years. Unprecedented flooding occurred throughout the river basin. Particularly affected were the marsh area below New Orleans and the entire Atchafalaya River Basin Morganza Spillway and Mississippi River in flood.
